soc.server

Class SOCServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • soc.server.genericServer.Server
        • soc.server.SOCServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Runnable

    public class SOCServer
extends Server
    A server for Settlers of Catan
    Author:
    Robert S. Thomas Note: This is an attempt at being more modular. 5/13/99 RST Note: Hopefully fixed all of the deadlock problems. 12/27/01 RST

    For server command line options, use the --help option.

    If the database is used (see SOCDBHelper), users can be set up with a username & password in that database to log in and play. Users without accounts can connect by leaving the password blank, as long as they aren't using a nickname which has a password in the database. There's a database setup script parameter SOCDBHelper.PROP_JSETTLERS_DB_SCRIPT_SETUP. If the setup script is ran, the server exits afterward, so that the script won't be part of the command line for normal server operation.

    Network Traffic and Message Flow:

    All messages from client connections arrive through SOCMessageDispatcher into either SOCGameMessageHandler or SOCServerMessageHandler, depending on whether the message is about a specific game. See those classes' javadocs for more details.

    The first message the server sends over the connection is its version and features (SOCVersion). This is sent immediately, without first waiting for the client to send its version.

    The first message the client sends over the connection is its version and locale (SOCVersion), to which the server responds with either SOCRejectConnection or the lists of channels and games (SOCChannels, SOCGames).

    The most important server systems:

    • SOCServer manages the overall lifecycle of the server and its games; game creation occurs in SOCGameListAtServer.createGame(String, String, String, SOCGameOptionSet, GameHandler).
    • See Server for details of the server threading and processing. After constructing a SOCServer instance, the caller must call Thread.start() to run the server's main thread.
    • Any built-in bots are started at serverUp().
    • After a game is created, in-game actions are handled by SOCGameHandler as called by the message handlers for client requests and actions in SOCGameMessageHandler and the game-lifecycle message handlers in SOCServerMessageHandler.
    • See SOCMessage for details of the client/server protocol.
    • To get a player's connection, use getConnection(plName).
    • To get a client's nickname, use Connection.getData().
    • To get the rest of a client's data, use getClientData(String) or (SOCClientData) Connection.getAppData().
    • To send a message to all players in a game, use messageToGame(String, boolean, SOCMessage) and related methods. Send text with messageToGameKeyed(SOCGame, boolean, boolean, String).
    • For i18n, nearly all text sent from the server starts as a unique key appearing in soc/server/strings/*.properties and is localized to the client's locale through Connection.getLocalized(String).
    • Timer threads are used to check for inactive robots and idle games: See SOCGameTimeoutChecker and SOCGameHandler.endTurnIfInactive(SOCGame, long).

    Properties and features:

    Java properties (starting with "jsettlers.") were added in 1.1.09, with constant names starting with PROP_JSETTLERS_ and listed in PROPS_LIST. Some properties activate optional features of the server.

    Debug Commands:

    The server supports several debug commands when isDebugUserEnabled(), and when sent as chat messages by a user named "debug" or by the only human in a practice game. See processDebugCommand(Connection, SOCGame, String, String) and SOCServerMessageHandler.handleGAMETEXTMSG(Connection, SOCGameTextMsg) for details.

    Other Notes:

    The version check timer is set in SOCClientData.setVersionTimer(SOCServer, Connection). Before 1.1.06 the server's currently active game and channel lists were sent beforehand, and client version was then sent in reply to server's version.
    See Also:

      For messageToPlayer(Connection, String, int, SOCMessage) and similar methods, "event playerNumber" parameter value to indicate this is the server's reply to a client player, and their player number is undetermined, possibly because current player's name isn't the client nickname so server knows client can't take an action right now.

      Integer property jsettlers.bots.botgames.parallel: When server is starting robot-only games (PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_TOTAL > 0), start this many at once.
      static java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_SHUTDOWN
      Boolean property jsettlers.bots.botgames.shutdown: If true, when server has started robot-only games (PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_TOTAL > 0) and those have finished, shut down the server if no other games are active.
      static java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_TOTAL
      Integer property jsettlers.bots.botgames.total will start robot-only games, a few at a time, until this many have been played.
      static java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_WAIT__SEC
      Integer property jsettlers.bots.botgames.wait_sec to wait this many seconds before starting robot-only games with PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_TOTAL.
      static java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_COOKIE
      String property jsettlers.bots.cookie to specify the robot connect cookie.
      static java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_FAST__PAUSE__PERCENT
      Integer property jsettlers.bots.fast_pause_percent to adjust the speed-up factor for bots' pause times between actions when SOCGame.isBotsOnly: Sets SOCRobotBrain.BOTS_ONLY_FAST_PAUSE_FACTOR.
      static java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_PAUSE_FOR_HUMAN_TRADE
      Integer property jsettlers.bot.human.pause to pause a robot for the specified number of seconds before considering a trade that's also offered to humans.
      static java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_PERCENT3P
      Integer property jsettlers.bots.percent3p to set a goal for the minimum percentage of third-party bots when randomly picking robots to start a game.
      static java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_SHOWCOOKIE
      Boolean property jsettlers.bots.showcookie to print the robot connect cookie to System.err during server startup.
      static java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_START3P
      String property jsettlers.bots.start3p: List of third-party bot classes to be started automatically by the server.
      static java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_TIMEOUT_TURN
      Integer property jsettlers.bots.timeout.turn to increase ROBOT_FORCE_ENDTURN_SECONDS for third-party robots, which may have more complex logic than the built-in bots.
      static java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_CLI_MAXCREATECHANNELS
      Property jsettlers.client.maxcreatechannels to limit the amount of chat channels that a client can create at once.
      static java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_CLI_MAXCREATEGAMES
      Property jsettlers.client.maxcreategames to limit the amount of games that a client can create at once.
      static java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_CONNECTIONS
      Property jsettlers.connections to specify the maximum number of connections allowed.
      static java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_GAME_DISALLOW_6PLAYER
      Boolean property jsettlers.game.disallow.6player to disallow 6-player games: Only 4 or fewer players allowed.
      static java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_GAME_DISALLOW_SEA__BOARD
      Boolean property jsettlers.game.disallow.sea_board to disallow use of the sea board and scenarios.
      static java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_GAMEOPT_PREFIX
      Property prefix jsettlers.gameopt. to specify game option defaults in a server properties file.
      static java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_GAMEOPTS_ACTIVATE
      Property jsettlers.gameopts.activate, a comma-separated list of inactive game options server will activate for use.
      static java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_PORT
      Property jsettlers.port to specify the port the server binds to and listens on.
      static java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_SAVEGAME_DIR
      Property jsettlers.savegame.dir to enable SAVEGAME/LOADGAME debug commands and set the directory in which to store savegame files.
      static java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_STARTROBOTS
      Property jsettlers.startrobots to start some robots when the server's threads start.
      static java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_STATS_FILE_NAME
      Property jsettlers.stats.file.name is the filename to append an optional daily stats summary with the same information as the *STATS* command, using StatsFileWriterTask.
      static java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_TEST_DB
      Boolean property jsettlers.test.db to test database methods, then exit with code 0 if OK or 1 if any required tests failed.
      static java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_TEST_VALIDATE__CONFIG
      From command-line flag -t or --test-config, boolean property jsettlers.test.validate_config to validate any server properties given in jsserver.properties or on the command line, print whether there were any problems, then exit with code 0 if OK or 1 if problems.
      static java.lang.String PROP_JVM_JSETTLERS_DEBUG_SERVER_GAMEOPT3P
      For server testing, JVM/system property "jsettlers.debug.server.gameopt3p" with name of a "third-party" Known Game Option to create; will have SOCGameOption.FLAG_3RD_PARTY and require client feature "com.example.js." + optionName.
      static java.lang.String[] PROPS_LIST
      List and descriptions of all available JSettlers properties, such as PROP_JSETTLERS_PORT and SOCDBHelper.PROP_JSETTLERS_DB_URL.
      static java.lang.String RESUME_RELOADED_FETCHING_ROBOTS
      Return value from resumeReloadedGame(Connection, SOCGame) when game couldn't immediately be resumed, but robot players are available and have been invited to cover the unclaimed human player seats.
      static int ROBOT_FORCE_ENDTURN_SECONDS
      Force robot to end their turn after this many seconds of inactivity.
      static int ROBOT_FORCE_ENDTURN_STUBBORN_SECONDS
      Force a particularly slow or buggy ("stubborn") robot to end their turn after this many seconds of inactivity.
      static SOCRobotParameters ROBOT_PARAMS_DEFAULT
      Robot default parameters; copied for each newly connecting robot.
      static SOCRobotParameters ROBOT_PARAMS_SMARTER
      Smarter robot default parameters.

      table of requests for robots to leave games
      (package private) java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,java.util.Hashtable<Connection,java.lang.Object>> robotJoinRequests
      Holds current requests for robots to join games:
      Key = Game name, value = Synchronized Hashtable with requested bot Connections and arbitrary related data; SOCGameHandler stores the bot's in-game seat number there as an Integer.

      protected boolean savegameInitFailed
      If true, initSocServer tried to set up savegameDir and the classes it relies on, but failed.
      static java.lang.String SERVERNAME

    • Property Detail

      • hasUtilityMode

        public final boolean hasUtilityModeProperty
        True if the server was constructed with a property or command line argument which is used to run the server in Utility Mode instead of Server Mode. In Utility Mode the server reads its properties, initializes its database connection if any, and performs one task such as a password reset or table/index creation. It won't start other threads and won't fail startup if TCP port binding fails.

        Utility Mode may also set a status message, see getUtilityModeMessage().

        The current Utility Mode properties/arguments are:

        • PROP_JSETTLERS_TEST_DB flag property
        • PROP_JSETTLERS_TEST_VALIDATE__CONFIG flag property
        • SOCDBHelper.PROP_JSETTLERS_DB_BCRYPT_WORK__FACTOR=test prop value
        • SOCDBHelper.PROP_JSETTLERS_DB_SCRIPT_SETUP property
        • SOCDBHelper.PROP_JSETTLERS_DB_UPGRADE__SCHEMA flag property
        • SOCDBHelper.PROP_JSETTLERS_DB_SETTINGS=write prop value
        • --pw-reset=username argument
        Since:
        1.1.20

    • Field Detail

      • SOC_PORT_DEFAULT

        public static final int SOC_PORT_DEFAULT
        Default tcp port number 8880 to listen, and for client to connect to remote server. Should match SOCPlayerClient.SOC_PORT_DEFAULT.

        8880 is the default SOCPlayerClient port since jsettlers 1.0.4, per cvs history.

        Since:
        1.1.09

      • SOC_STARTROBOTS_DEFAULT

        public static final int SOC_STARTROBOTS_DEFAULT

      • PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_PERCENT3P

        public static final java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_PERCENT3P
        Integer property jsettlers.bots.percent3p to set a goal for the minimum percentage of third-party bots when randomly picking robots to start a game. If set, should be in range 0 to 100 inclusive.

        If not enough third-party bots are connected to the server when starting a game, the built-in bots will be used instead so that the game can begin. If also using PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_TOTAL, remember those games will be started as soon as the server is ready, so the third-party bots may not yet be connected. To wait longer, use PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_WAIT__SEC.

        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_START3P, Constant Field Values

      • PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_START3P

        public static final java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_START3P
        String property jsettlers.bots.start3p: List of third-party bot classes to be started automatically by the server.

        The server can do this for any bots whose client class:

        • Is a subclass of SOCRobotClient
        • Is on the server's CLASSPATH
        • Has a constructor which takes the same args as soc.robot.SOCRobotClient's and soc.robot.sample3p.Sample3PClient's: (ServerConnectInfo, String, String)
        Third-party bots in general don't have to extend SOCRobotClient, but the current server code only knows how to start such subclasses. So, non-subclassed bots will need to be started and connected manually.

        This example starts 3 of bot X, 1 of bot Y, 5 of bot Z:
        jsettlers.bots.start3p=3,com.example.BotXClient,org.example.BotYClient,5,net.example.BotZClient

        This starts 2 of the example "third-party" bot:
        jsettlers.bots.start3p=2,soc.robot.sample3p.Sample3PClient

        Since:
        2.2.00
        See Also:
        PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_WAIT__SEC, PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_PERCENT3P, Constant Field Values

      • PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_TIMEOUT_TURN

        public static final java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_TIMEOUT_TURN
        Integer property jsettlers.bots.timeout.turn to increase ROBOT_FORCE_ENDTURN_SECONDS for third-party robots, which may have more complex logic than the built-in bots. The third-party bots will have this many seconds to make a move before the server ends their turn.

        Default is ROBOT_FORCE_ENDTURN_SECONDS. The built-in robots are limited to ROBOT_FORCE_ENDTURN_SECONDS even when this property is set.

        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_FAST__PAUSE__PERCENT

        public static final java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_FAST__PAUSE__PERCENT
        Integer property jsettlers.bots.fast_pause_percent to adjust the speed-up factor for bots' pause times between actions when SOCGame.isBotsOnly: Sets SOCRobotBrain.BOTS_ONLY_FAST_PAUSE_FACTOR.

        Default is 25, for 25% of normal pauses (4x speed). Use 1 for a shorter delay (1% of normal pauses).

        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_TOTAL, Constant Field Values

      • PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_TOTAL

        public static final java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_TOTAL
        Integer property jsettlers.bots.botgames.total will start robot-only games, a few at a time, until this many have been played. (The default is 0.) As the first few games end, the server will start new games until the total is reached.

        To adjust the robot-only game speed and server load, use PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_FAST__PAUSE__PERCENT and PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_PARALLEL.

        To start games of different sizes/board types, set PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_GAMETYPES.

        To wait at server startup time before starting these games, use PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_WAIT__SEC. To shut down the server after they all finish, use PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_SHUTDOWN.

        If this property's value != 0, a robots-only game can be started with the *STARTBOTGAME* debug command. This can be used to test the bots with any given combination of game options and scenarios. To permit starting such games without automatically starting any at server startup, use a value less than 0.

        If this property's value != 0, a game with 1 human player against bots, and 1 or more observers, won't be ended if that sole human player quits. A bot will replace the human, and the game will continue as a robots-only game. Otherwise any robots-only game will be ended even if it has observers.

        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_PERCENT3P, Constant Field Values

      • PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_GAMETYPES

        public static final java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_GAMETYPES
        Integer property jsettlers.bots.botgames.gametypes: The mix of game sizes and board types to use when starting bot-only games (PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_TOTAL > 0).
        • 1 (default): Only 4-player games
        • 2: Also 6-player games (50/50 mix)
        • 3: Also sea board (50/50 mix of sea/classic, still 50/50 mix of 4- and 6-player) with no scenarios
        • Any other number: Will not run
        Ignored unless PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_TOTAL > 0.
        Since:
        2.3.00
        See Also:
        BOTS_BOTGAMES_GAMETYPES_MAX, Constant Field Values

      • BOTS_BOTGAMES_GAMETYPES_MAX

        public static final int BOTS_BOTGAMES_GAMETYPES_MAX
        Maximum recognized value for PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_GAMETYPES: 3. May increase in a later version.
        Since:
        2.3.00
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_PARALLEL

        public static final java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_PARALLEL
        Integer property jsettlers.bots.botgames.parallel: When server is starting robot-only games (PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_TOTAL > 0), start this many at once.

        Default is 4. Use 0 to start them all.
        Before v2.3.00, default was 2.

        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_SHUTDOWN

        public static final java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_SHUTDOWN
        Boolean property jsettlers.bots.botgames.shutdown: If true, when server has started robot-only games (PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_TOTAL > 0) and those have finished, shut down the server if no other games are active. (Default is false.)
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_WAIT__SEC

        public static final java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_WAIT__SEC
        Integer property jsettlers.bots.botgames.wait_sec to wait this many seconds before starting robot-only games with PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_TOTAL. This is useful if some bots are slow to start, or are third-party bots not automatically started with the server. (The default is 1.6 seconds.)

        To start some third-party bots with the server, see PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_START3P.

        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_PERCENT3P, Constant Field Values

      • PROP_JSETTLERS_STARTROBOTS

        public static final java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_STARTROBOTS
        Property jsettlers.startrobots to start some robots when the server's threads start. (The default is SOC_STARTROBOTS_DEFAULT.)

        30% will be "smart" robots, the other 70% will be "fast" robots. Remember that robots count against the max connections limit.

        Before v1.1.19 the default was 0, no robots were started by default. Before v2.0.00 no bots were started unless the server constructor was given a non-null Properties.

        Since:
        1.1.09
        See Also:
        PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_TOTAL, Constant Field Values

      • PROP_JSETTLERS_ACCOUNTS_OPEN

        public static final java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_ACCOUNTS_OPEN
        Open Registration Mode boolean property jsettlers.accounts.open. If this property is Y, anyone can self-register to create their own user accounts. Otherwise only users in PROP_JSETTLERS_ACCOUNTS_ADMINS can create new accounts after the first account.

        The default is N in version 1.1.19 and newer; previously was Y by default. To require that all players have accounts in the database, see PROP_JSETTLERS_ACCOUNTS_REQUIRED.

        If this field is Y when the server is initialized, the server calls features.add(SOCFeatureSet.SERVER_OPEN_REG).

        Since:
        1.1.19
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROP_JSETTLERS_ACCOUNTS_REQUIRED

        public static final java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_ACCOUNTS_REQUIRED
        Boolean property jsettlers.accounts.required to require that all players have user accounts. If this property is Y, a jdbc database is required and all users must have an account and password in the database. If a client tries to join or create a game or channel without providing a password, they will be sent SOCStatusMessage.SV_PW_REQUIRED. This property implies SOCFeatureSet.SERVER_ACCOUNTS.

        The default is N.

        If PROP_JSETTLERS_ACCOUNTS_OPEN is used, anyone can create their own account (Open Registration). Otherwise see PROP_JSETTLERS_ACCOUNTS_ADMINS for the list of user admin accounts.

        Since:
        1.1.19
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROP_JSETTLERS_ACCOUNTS_ADMINS

        public static final java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_ACCOUNTS_ADMINS
        Property jsettlers.accounts.admins to specify the Account Admin usernames which can create accounts and run user-related commands. If this property is set, it is a comma-separated list of usernames (nicknames), and a user must authenticate and be on this list to create user accounts. If not set, no new accounts can be created unless PROP_JSETTLERS_ACCOUNTS_OPEN is true.

        If any other user requests account creation, the server will reply with SOCStatusMessage.SV_ACCT_NOT_CREATED_DENIED.

        The server doesn't require or check at startup that the named accounts all already exist, this is just a list of names.

        This property can't be set at the same time as PROP_JSETTLERS_ACCOUNTS_OPEN, they ask for opposing security policies.

        Before v1.2.00, any authenticated user could create accounts.

        Since:
        1.1.19
        See Also:
        isUserDBUserAdmin(String), Constant Field Values

      • PROP_JSETTLERS_ADMIN_WELCOME

        public static final java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_ADMIN_WELCOME
        Optional property jsettlers.admin.welcome to customize the welcome message text sent to clients when they connect or create their first game. This text appears on the client's main panel status line.

        Default text in english is "Welcome to Java Settlers of Catan!". Custom message is not currently localizable.

        Text can't start with digit or comma, to ensure correct handling at client by SOCStatusMessage.parseDataStr(String) when sent with status value 0. May contain any symbols except SOCMessage.sep_char, newlines, or control characters.

        At startup, server checks the format of this property, trims whitespace, and if empty, removes it from internal props list. If format is invalid, server halts startup.

        Since:
        2.3.00
        See Also:
        getClientWelcomeMessage(Connection), Constant Field Values

      • PROP_JSETTLERS_ALLOW_DEBUG

        public static final java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_ALLOW_DEBUG
        Property jsettlers.allow.debug to permit debug commands over TCP. (The default is N; to allow, set to Y)
        Since:
        1.1.14
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROP_JSETTLERS_CLI_MAXCREATEGAMES

        public static final java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_CLI_MAXCREATEGAMES
        Property jsettlers.client.maxcreategames to limit the amount of games that a client can create at once. (The default is 5.) Once a game is completed and deleted (all players leave), they can create another. Set this to -1 to disable it; 0 will disallow any game creation. This limit is ignored for practice games.
        Since:
        1.1.10
        See Also:
        CLIENT_MAX_CREATE_GAMES, Constant Field Values

      • PROP_JSETTLERS_CLI_MAXCREATECHANNELS

        public static final java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_CLI_MAXCREATECHANNELS
        Property jsettlers.client.maxcreatechannels to limit the amount of chat channels that a client can create at once. (The default is 2.) Once a channel is deleted (all members leave), they can create another. Set this to -1 to disable it; 0 will disallow any chat channel creation.
        Since:
        1.1.10
        See Also:
        CLIENT_MAX_CREATE_CHANNELS, SOCFeatureSet.SERVER_CHANNELS, Constant Field Values

      • PROP_JSETTLERS_GAMEOPT_PREFIX

        public static final java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_GAMEOPT_PREFIX
        Property prefix jsettlers.gameopt. to specify game option defaults in a server properties file. Option names are case-insensitive past this prefix. Syntax for default value is the same as on the command line, for example: 
         jsettlers.gameopt.RD=y
 jsettlers.gameopt.n7=t7

        See parseCmdline_DashedArgs(String[]) for how game option properties are checked at startup.

        Since:
        1.1.20
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROP_JSETTLERS_STATS_FILE_NAME

        Property jsettlers.stats.file.name is the filename to append an optional daily stats summary with the same information as the *STATS* command, using StatsFileWriterTask.

        Can be a full path, or relative to the JSettlers startup directory which contains jsserver.properties. If this file's directory is not writable, server will warn at startup.

      • PROP_JSETTLERS_TEST_DB

      • PROP_JSETTLERS_TEST_VALIDATE__CONFIG

        public static final java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_TEST_VALIDATE__CONFIG
        From command-line flag -t or --test-config, boolean property jsettlers.test.validate_config to validate any server properties given in jsserver.properties or on the command line, print whether there were any problems, then exit with code 0 if OK or 1 if problems.

        If DB connect properties are given, validation will include connecting to the database. Failure to successfully connect will cause exit code 1.

        Setting this property true will also set hasUtilityModeProperty().

        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROPS_LIST

        public static final java.lang.String[] PROPS_LIST
        List and descriptions of all available JSettlers properties, such as PROP_JSETTLERS_PORT and SOCDBHelper.PROP_JSETTLERS_DB_URL.

        Each property name is followed in the array by a brief description: [0] is a property, [1] is its description, [2] is the next property, etc. (This was added in 1.1.13 for printUsage(boolean)).

        When you add or update any property, please also update /src/main/bin/jsserver.properties.sample.

        Since:
        1.1.09

      • PROP_JVM_JSETTLERS_DEBUG_SERVER_GAMEOPT3P

        public static final java.lang.String PROP_JVM_JSETTLERS_DEBUG_SERVER_GAMEOPT3P
        For server testing, JVM/system property "jsettlers.debug.server.gameopt3p" with name of a "third-party" Known Game Option to create; will have SOCGameOption.FLAG_3RD_PARTY and require client feature "com.example.js." + optionName.

        For robots' benefit, if this system property is set but the equivalent client property SOCDisplaylessPlayerClient.PROP_JSETTLERS_DEBUG_CLIENT_GAMEOPT3P isn't, server will set that to the same value.

        Since:

      • GAME_TIME_EXPIRE_WARN_MINUTES

        public static int GAME_TIME_EXPIRE_WARN_MINUTES
        If game will expire in this or fewer minutes, warn the players. Default is 15. Must be at least twice the sleep-time in SOCGameTimeoutChecker.run(). The game expiry time is set at game creation in SOCGameListAtServer.createGame(String, String, String, SOCGameOptionSet, GameHandler).

        If you update this field, also update GAME_TIME_EXPIRE_CHECK_MINUTES.

        Before v2.0.00 this field was named GAME_EXPIRE_WARN_MINUTES.
        Before v1.2.01 the default was 10.

        Since:
        1.1.00
        See Also:
        checkForExpiredGames(long), SOCGameTimeoutChecker.run(), SOCGameListAtServer.GAME_TIME_EXPIRE_MINUTES, GAME_TIME_EXPIRE_ADDTIME_MINUTES

      • GAME_TIME_EXPIRE_CHECK_MINUTES

        public static int GAME_TIME_EXPIRE_CHECK_MINUTES
        Sleep time (minutes) between checks for expired games in SOCGameTimeoutChecker.run(). Default is 5 minutes. Must be at most half of GAME_TIME_EXPIRE_WARN_MINUTES so the user has time to react after seeing the warning.
        Since:
        1.2.00
        See Also:
        SOCGameListAtServer.GAME_TIME_EXPIRE_MINUTES

      • GAME_TIME_EXPIRE_ADDTIME_MINUTES

        public static final int GAME_TIME_EXPIRE_ADDTIME_MINUTES
        Amount of time to add (30 minutes) when the *ADDTIME* command is used by a player.
        Since:
        1.1.20
        See Also:
        GAME_TIME_EXPIRE_WARN_MINUTES, Constant Field Values

      • ROBOT_FORCE_ENDTURN_SECONDS

        public static int ROBOT_FORCE_ENDTURN_SECONDS
        Force robot to end their turn after this many seconds of inactivity. Keeps the game moving if bot is stuck or indecisive because of a bug. Default is 8.

        Can override this for third-party bots by setting PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_TIMEOUT_TURN.

        After a bot is forced several times to end its turn, it's considered "stubborn" and given a shorter timeout (ROBOT_FORCE_ENDTURN_STUBBORN_SECONDS) so human players won't always have to wait so long.

        Since:
        1.1.11
        See Also:
        checkForExpiredTurns(long)

      • ROBOT_FORCE_ENDTURN_STUBBORN_SECONDS

        public static int ROBOT_FORCE_ENDTURN_STUBBORN_SECONDS
        Force a particularly slow or buggy ("stubborn") robot to end their turn after this many seconds of inactivity. Must be shorter than ROBOT_FORCE_ENDTURN_SECONDS. Default is 4. Sets frequency of SOCGameTimeoutChecker's checks for expired turns.
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        SOCPlayer.isStubbornRobot(), SOCPlayer.STUBBORN_ROBOT_FORCE_END_TURN_THRESHOLD

      • PLAYER_NAME_MAX_LENGTH

        public static int PLAYER_NAME_MAX_LENGTH
        Maximum permitted player name length, default 20 characters. Clients older than v2.0.00 truncate nickname to 20 characters in SOCPlayerClient.getValidNickname before sending.
        Since:
        1.1.07
        See Also:
        createOrJoinGameIfUserOK(Connection, String, String, String, SOCGameOptionSet), SOCGameList.GAME_NAME_MAX_LENGTH

      • CLIENT_MAX_CREATE_GAMES

        public static int CLIENT_MAX_CREATE_GAMES
        Maximum number of games that a client can create at the same time (default 5). Once this limit is reached, the client must delete a game before creating a new one. Set this to -1 to disable it; 0 will disallow any game creation. This limit is ignored for practice games.
        Since:
        1.1.10
        See Also:
        PROP_JSETTLERS_CLI_MAXCREATEGAMES

      • CLIENT_MAX_CREATE_CHANNELS

        public static int CLIENT_MAX_CREATE_CHANNELS
        Maximum number of chat channels that a client can create at the same time (default 2). Once this limit is reached, the client must delete a channel before creating a new one. Set this to -1 to disable it; 0 will disallow any chat channel creation.

        If this field is nonzero when the server is initialized, the server calls features.add(SOCFeatureSet.SERVER_CHANNELS). If the field value is changed afterwards, that affects new clients joining the server but does not clear SERVER_CHANNELS from the features list.

        Since:
        1.1.10
        See Also:
        PROP_JSETTLERS_CLI_MAXCREATECHANNELS

      • PN_NON_EVENT

        public static final int PN_NON_EVENT
        For messageToPlayer(Connection, String, int, SOCMessage) and similar methods, "event playerNumber" parameter value to indicate message isn't an event and shouldn't be recorded.

        Example: Explaining a syntax error in a debug/admin command they sent.

        Since:
        2.4.50
        See Also:
        PN_OBSERVER, PN_REPLY_TO_UNDETERMINED, Constant Field Values

      • PN_OBSERVER

        public static final int PN_OBSERVER
        For messageToPlayer(Connection, String, int, SOCMessage) and similar methods, "event playerNumber" parameter value to indicate this is from the server to an observing client who's joined the game but isn't sitting as a player.

        Also used when inviting a bot client to join a game, although they aren't a game member yet.

        Since:
        2.4.50
        See Also:
        PN_NON_EVENT, PN_REPLY_TO_UNDETERMINED, Constant Field Values

      • PN_REPLY_TO_UNDETERMINED

        public static final int PN_REPLY_TO_UNDETERMINED
        For messageToPlayer(Connection, String, int, SOCMessage) and similar methods, "event playerNumber" parameter value to indicate this is the server's reply to a client player, and their player number is undetermined, possibly because current player's name isn't the client nickname so server knows client can't take an action right now.
        Since:
        2.4.50
        See Also:
        PN_NON_EVENT, PN_OBSERVER, Constant Field Values

      • robotJoinRequests

        final java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,java.util.Hashtable<Connection,java.lang.Object>> robotJoinRequests
        Holds current requests for robots to join games:
        Key = Game name, value = Synchronized Hashtable with requested bot Connections and arbitrary related data; SOCGameHandler stores the bot's in-game seat number there as an Integer.

      • numberOfGamesStarted

        protected int numberOfGamesStarted
        The total number of games that have been started: GameHandler.startGame(SOCGame) has been called and game play has begun. Game state became GameState.READY or higher from an earlier/lower state.

      • numberOfGamesFinished

        protected int numberOfGamesFinished
        The total number of games finished: Game state became GameState.GAME_OVER or higher from an earlier/lower state. Incremented in gameOverIncrGamesFinishedCount(SOCGame).

        Before v1.1.20 this was the number of games destroyed, and *STATS* wouldn't reflect a newly finished game until all players had left that game.

        See Also:
        numberOfGamesFinishedWithBots

      • numberOfGamesFinishedWithBots

        protected int numberOfGamesFinishedWithBots
        The total number of games finished which had at least 1 robot at the end of the game. See numberOfGamesFinished for details.
        Since:
        2.3.00
        See Also:
        numberOfGamesFinished, numberOfBotsInFinishedGames

        Since:
        2.3.00

      • clientPastVersionStats

    • Constructor Detail

      • SOCServer

        public SOCServer(int port,
                 int mc,
                 java.lang.String databaseUserName,
                 java.lang.String databasePassword)
          throws java.net.SocketException,
                 java.io.EOFException,
                 java.sql.SQLException,
                 java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Create a Settlers of Catan server listening on TCP port p. Most server threads are started here; you must start its main thread yourself. Optionally connect to a database for user info and game stats.

        The default number of bots will be started here (SOC_STARTROBOTS_DEFAULT) since this constructor has no Properties to override that.

        In 1.1.07 and later, will also print game options to stderr if any option defaults require a minimum client version, or if hasSetGameOptions is set.

        Parameters:
        port - the TCP port that the server listens on
        mc - the maximum number of connections allowed; remember that robots count against this limit.
        databaseUserName - the user name for accessing the database
        databasePassword - the password for the db user, or ""
        Throws:
        java.net.SocketException - If a network setup problem occurs
        java.io.EOFException - If db setup script ran successfully and server should exit now
        java.sql.SQLException - If db setup script fails, or if required tests failed in SOCDBHelper.testDBHelper()
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If Version.versionNumber() returns 0 (packaging error)

      • SOCServer

        public SOCServer(int port,
                 java.util.Properties props)
          throws java.net.SocketException,
                 java.io.EOFException,
                 java.sql.SQLException,
                 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                 java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Create a Settlers of Catan server listening on TCP port p. Most server threads are started here; you must start its main thread yourself. Optionally connect to a database for user info and game stats.

        The database properties are SOCDBHelper.PROP_JSETTLERS_DB_USER and SOCDBHelper.PROP_JSETTLERS_DB_PASS.

        To run a DB setup script to create database tables, send its filename or relative path as SOCDBHelper.PROP_JSETTLERS_DB_SCRIPT_SETUP.

        If a db URL or other DB properties are specified in props, but SOCServer can't successfully connect to that database, this constructor throws SQLException; for details see initSocServer(String, String). Other constructors can't set those properties, and will instead continue SOCServer startup and run without any database.

        Will also print game options to stderr if any option defaults require a minimum client version, or if hasSetGameOptions is set.

        Utility Mode:

        Some properties such as SOCDBHelper.PROP_JSETTLERS_DB_SCRIPT_SETUP will initialize the server environment, connect to the database, perform a single task, and exit. This is called Utility Mode. In Utility Mode the caller should not start threads or continue normal startup (Server Mode). See hasUtilityModeProperty() for more details.

        For the password reset property SOCDBHelper.PROP_IMPL_JSETTLERS_PW_RESET, the caller will need to prompt for and change the password; this constructor will not do that.

        Parameters:
        port - the TCP port that the server listens on
        props - null, or properties containing PROP_JSETTLERS_CONNECTIONS and any other desired properties.

        Property names are held in PROP_* and SOCDBHelper.PROP_* constants; see PROPS_LIST.

        If props contains game option default values (see below) with non-uppercase gameopt names, cannot be read-only: Startup will replace keys such as "jsettlers.gameopt.vp" with their canonical uppercase equivalent: "jsettlers.gameopt.VP"

        If props is null, the properties will be created empty.

        Unless props contains PROP_JSETTLERS_STARTROBOTS == 0, the default number SOC_STARTROBOTS_DEFAULT of bots will be started.

        props may contain game option default values (property names starting with PROP_JSETTLERS_GAMEOPT_PREFIX). Calls parseCmdline_GameOption(SOCGameOption, String, HashMap) for each one found, to set its default (current) value. If a default scenario is specified (game option "SC"), the scenario may include game options which conflict with those in props: Consider calling checkScenarioOpts(Map, boolean, String) to check for that and warn the user.

        If you provide props, consider checking for a jsserver.properties file (SOC_SERVER_PROPS_FILENAME) and calling Properties.load(java.io.InputStream) with it before calling this constructor.

        Throws:
        java.net.SocketException - If a network setup problem occurs
        java.io.EOFException - If db setup script or upgrade ran successfully and server should exit now
        java.sql.SQLException - If db setup script or upgrade fails, or needs db but can't connect, or if required tests failed in SOCDBHelper.testDBHelper(), or if other problems with DB-related contents of props (exception's Throwable.getCause() will be an IllegalArgumentException or DBSettingMismatchException); see SOCDBHelper.initialize(String, String, Properties) javadoc. This constructor prints the SQLException details to System.err, caller doesn't need to extract the cause and print those same details.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If props contains game options (jsettlers.gameopt.*) with bad syntax. See PROP_JSETTLERS_GAMEOPT_PREFIX for expected syntax. See parseCmdline_DashedArgs(String[]) for how game option properties are checked. Throwable.getMessage() will have problem details.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If Version.versionNumber() returns 0 (packaging error)
        Since:
        1.1.09
        See Also:
        PROPS_LIST

      • SOCServer

        public SOCServer(java.lang.String stringport)
          throws java.net.SocketException,
                 java.io.EOFException,
                 java.sql.SQLException,
                 java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Create a Settlers of Catan server listening on local stringport s. Most server threads are started here; you must start its main thread yourself. Optionally connect to a database for user info and game stats.

        The default number of bots will be started here (SOC_STARTROBOTS_DEFAULT) since this constructor has no Properties to override that.

        In 1.1.07 and later, will also print game options to stderr if any option defaults require a minimum client version, or if hasSetGameOptions is set.

        Parameters:
        stringport - the stringport that the server listens on. If this is a "practice game" server on the user's local computer, please use Connection.JVM_STRINGPORT.
        Throws:
        java.net.SocketException - If a network setup problem occurs
        java.io.EOFException - If db setup script ran successfully and server should exit now
        java.sql.SQLException - If db setup script or upgrade fails, or if required tests failed in SOCDBHelper.testDBHelper()
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If Version.versionNumber() returns 0 (packaging error)
        Since:
        1.1.00
        See Also:
        SOCServer(String, Properties)

      • SOCServer

        public SOCServer(java.lang.String s,
                 java.util.Properties props)
          throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Create a Settlers of Catan server listening on local stringport s with properties props. Most server threads are started here; you must start its main thread yourself.

        Will also print game options to stderr if any option defaults require a minimum client version, or if hasSetGameOptions is set.

        Parameters:
        s - the stringport that the server listens on. If this is a "practice game" server on the user's local computer, please use Connection.JVM_STRINGPORT.
        props - null, or properties containing PROP_JSETTLERS_CONNECTIONS and any other desired properties.

        Property names are held in PROP_* and SOCDBHelper.PROP_* constants; see PROPS_LIST.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If Version.versionNumber() returns 0 (packaging error) see {link #SOCServer(int, int, String, String)}
        Since:
        2.4.50

    • Method Detail

      • serverUp

        public void serverUp()
              throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Callback to take care of things when server comes up, after the server socket is bound and listening, in the server's main thread.

        Unless PROP_JSETTLERS_STARTROBOTS is 0, starts those SOCRobotClients now by calling setupLocalRobots(int, int). If PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_TOTAL is specified, waits briefly and then calls startRobotOnlyGames(boolean, boolean).

        Once this method completes, server begins its main loop of listening for incoming client connections, and starting a Thread for each one to handle that client's messages.

        If overriding this callback, be sure to call super.serverUp() either before or after your own code, depending on when you want robots to be started.

        Overrides:
        serverUp in class Server
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If server was constructed in Utility Mode and shouldn't continue normal startup; see hasUtilityModeProperty() for details.
        Since:
        1.1.09

      • getRobotParameters

        public final SOCRobotParameters getRobotParameters(java.lang.String botName)
        Get this robot's specialized parameters from the optional database if it has an entry there, or defaults for its type based on botName. Calls SOCDBHelper.retrieveRobotParams(String).

        Default bot params are ROBOT_PARAMS_SMARTER if the robot name starts with "robot ", or ROBOT_PARAMS_DEFAULT otherwise (starts with "droid "). This matches the bot names generated in setupLocalRobots(int, int).

        Parameters:
        botName - Name of robot for parameter lookup
        Returns:
        Bot parameters from DB if used and bot name found there, or defaults for bot type as described above. Never null unless botName is null.
        Since:
        2.3.00

      • connectToChannel

        Parameters:

        ch - the name of the channel

      • leaveChannel

        public boolean leaveChannel(Connection c,
                            java.lang.String ch,
                            boolean destroyIfEmpty,
                            boolean channelListLock)
        Connection c leaves the channel ch. Send SOCLeaveChannel message to remaining members of ch. If the channel becomes empty after removing c, this method can destroy it.

        Note: Caller must send SOCDeleteChannel message, this method does not do so.

        Locks: Must have channelList.takeMonitorForChannel(ch) when calling this method. May or may not have SOCChannelList.takeMonitor(), see channelListLock parameter.

        Parameters:
        c - the connection
        ch - the channel
        destroyIfEmpty - if true, this method will destroy the channel if it's now empty. If false, the caller must call destroyChannel(String) before calling SOCChannelList.releaseMonitor().
        channelListLock - true if we have the SOCChannelList.takeMonitor() lock when called; false if it must be acquired and released within this method
        Returns:
        true if we destroyed the channel, or if it would have been destroyed but destroyIfEmpty is false.

      • destroyChannel

        protected final void destroyChannel(java.lang.String ch)
        Destroy a channel and then clean up related data, such as the owner's count of SOCClientData.getcurrentCreatedChannels(). Calls SOCChannelList.deleteChannel(String).

        Note: Caller must send SOCDeleteChannel message, this method does not do so.

        Locks: Must have channelList.takeMonitor() before calling this method.

        Parameters:
        ch - Name of the channel to destroy
        Since:
        1.1.20
        See Also:
        leaveChannel(Connection, String, boolean, boolean)

      • connectToGame

        public boolean connectToGame(Connection c,
                             java.lang.String gaName,
                             SOCGameOptionSet gaOpts,
                             SOCGame loadedGame)
                      throws SOCGameOptionVersionException,
                             java.util.MissingResourceException,
                             java.util.NoSuchElementException,
                             java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                             java.lang.RuntimeException
        Adds a connection to a game, unless they're already a member. If the game doesn't yet exist, creates it and announces the new game to all clients by calling createGameAndBroadcast(Connection, String, SOCGameOptionSet, SOCGame, int, boolean, boolean). After this method returns, caller must call joinGame(SOCGame, Connection, boolean, boolean, boolean) to send game state to the player/observer.

        If this method creates a new game: After it returns, other human players may join until someone clicks "Start Game". At that point, server will look for robots to fill empty seats.

        Parameters:
        c - the Connection to be added to the game; its name, version, and locale should already be set.
        gaName - the name of the game; ignored if loadedGame != null. Not validated or trimmed, see createOrJoinGameIfUserOK(Connection, String, String, String, SOCGameOptionSet) for that.
        gaOpts - if creating a game with options, its SOCGameOptions; otherwise null. Must already be validated, by calling SOCGameOptionSet.adjustOptionsToKnown(SOCGameOptionSet, boolean,SOCFeatureSet,Map ) with doServerPreadjust true.
        loadedGame - Game being reloaded, or null when joining an existing game or creating a new one. Should not be in server's gameList yet.
        Returns:
        true if c was not a member of the game before, or if new game created; false if c was already in this game
        Throws:
        SOCGameOptionVersionException - if asking to create a game (gaOpts != null), but client's version is too low to join because of a requested game option's minimum version in gaOpts. Calculated via SOCGameOptionSet.optionsNewerThanVersion(int, boolean, boolean). (this exception was added in 1.1.07)
        java.util.MissingResourceException - if client has SOCClientData.hasLimitedFeats and ! SOCGame.canClientJoin(SOCFeatureSet). The missing feature(s) are in the MissingResourceException.getKey() field, in the format returned by SOCGame.checkClientFeatures(SOCFeatureSet, boolean). (this exception was added in 2.0.00)
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if loadedGame != null, its game name is already in use, and an unused name couldn't be generated.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if client's version is too low to join for any other reason. (this exception was added in 1.1.06)
        java.lang.RuntimeException
        See Also:
        SOCServerMessageHandler.handleSTARTGAME(Connection, SOCStartGame, int), SOCServerMessageHandler.handleJOINGAME(Connection, SOCJoinGame)

      • leaveGame

        public boolean leaveGame(Connection c,
                         SOCGame ga,
                         java.lang.String gm,
                         boolean hasReplacement,
                         boolean hasHumanReplacement,
                         boolean destroyIfEmpty,
                         boolean hasGameListLock)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        the connection c leaves the game gm. Clean up; if needed, force the current player's turn to end.

        If the game becomes empty after removing c, this method can destroy it if all these conditions are true (determined by GameHandler.leaveGame(SOCGame, Connection, boolean, boolean)):

        • c was the last non-robot player
        • c not being replaced by a human player
        • No one was watching/observing
        • SOCGame.isBotsOnly flag is false

        Locks: Has gameList.takeMonitorForGame(gm) when calling this method; should not have SOCGame.takeMonitor(). May or may not have SOCGameList.takeMonitor(), see gameListLock parameter.

        Before v1.2.01, games where all players were bots would continue playing if at least one client was watching/observing. In v2.0.00 and newer, such games can continue only if bot-development property jsettlers.bots.botgames.total != 0 and there is an observer. (v1.2.xx does not have that property, and will destroy the game.)

        Parameters:
        c - the connection; if c is being dropped because of an error, this method assumes that Connection.disconnect() has already been called. This method won't exclude c from any communication about leaving the game, in case they are still connected and in other games.
        ga - game to leave, if already known from SOCGameListAtServer.getGameData(String)
        gm - game name, if ga object not already known
        hasReplacement - If true the leaving connection is a bot, and there's a waiting client who will be told next to sit down in this bot's seat, so that isn't really becoming vacant
        hasHumanReplacement - if true, hasReplacement's client is human, not a bot
        destroyIfEmpty - if true, this method will destroy the game if it's now empty. If false, the caller must call destroyGame(String) before calling SOCGameList.releaseMonitor().
        hasGameListLock - true if caller holds the SOCGameList.takeMonitor() lock when called; false if it must be acquired and released within this method
        Returns:
        true only if the game was destroyed, or if it would have been destroyed but destroyIfEmpty is false
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if both ga and gm are null

      • leaveGameMemberAndCleanup

        void leaveGameMemberAndCleanup(Connection c,
                               SOCGame game,
                               java.lang.String gaName)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Handle a member leaving the game:
        • Manages game list locks
        • Calls leaveGame(Connection, SOCGame, String, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean)
        • If game now destroyed, announces game deletion
        • If leaving member was a bot, remove it from robotDismissRequests for this game. Calls sitDown(SOCGame, Connection, int, boolean, boolean) if a human player is replacing the bot.
        Before v2.0.00 this method was handleLEAVEGAME_member called only from SOCServerMessageHandler.handleLEAVEGAME(Connection, SOCLeaveGame).
        Parameters:
        c - the connection leaving the game
        game - game to leave, if already known from SOCGameListAtServer.getGameData(String)
        gaName - game name, if game object not already known
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if both game and gaName are null
        Since:
        1.1.07

      • robotShuffleForJoin

      • setupLocalRobots

        public boolean setupLocalRobots(int numFast,
                                int numSmart)
        Set up some robot opponents, running in our JVM for operator convenience. Set up more than needed; when a game is started, game setup will randomize whether its humans will play against smart or fast ones. (Some will be SOCRobotDM.FAST_STRATEGY, some SMART_STRATEGY).

        The bots will start up and connect in separate threads, then be given their FAST or SMART strategy params in SOCLocalRobotClient.createAndStartRobotClientThread(String, ServerConnectInfo, Constructor) based on their name prefixes ("droid " or "robot " respectively): See getRobotParameters(String).

        Some third-party bot clients can automatically be started here, if they're named in PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_START3P and meet the criteria documented there. Those bots will be named "extrabot 1", "extrabot 2", etc.

        In v1.2.00 and newer, human players can't use names with bot prefixes "droid " or "robot ", and in v2.2.00 and newer "extrabot " also; see checkNickname(String, Connection, boolean, boolean).

        Before 1.1.09, this method was part of SOCPlayerClient.

        Parameters:
        numFast - number of fast robots, with FAST_STRATEGY
        numSmart - number of smart robots, with SMART_STRATEGY
        Returns:
        True if robots were set up, false if an exception occurred. This typically happens if a third-party robot class can't be loaded.
        Since:
        1.1.00
        See Also:
        SOCPlayerClient.startPracticeGame(String, SOCGameOptionSet, boolean), MainDisplay.startLocalTCPServer(int), startRobotOnlyGames(boolean, boolean), SOCLocalRobotClient

      • destroyGame

        public void destroyGame(java.lang.String gm)
        Destroy a game and clean up related data, such as the owner's count of SOCClientData.getCurrentCreatedGames().

        Note that if this game had the SOCGame.isBotsOnly flag, and numRobotOnlyGamesRemaining > 0, will call startRobotOnlyGames(boolean, boolean). If none remain, will shut down server if PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_SHUTDOWN is true and active game list is empty.

        Locks: Must have gameList.takeMonitor() before calling this method.

        Parameters:
        gm - Name of the game to destroy
        See Also:
        leaveGame(Connection, SOCGame, String, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean), destroyGameAndBroadcast(String, String)

      • destroyGameAndBroadcast

        public void destroyGameAndBroadcast(java.lang.String gaName,
                                    java.lang.String descForStackTrace)
        Destroy a game and then broadcast its deletion, including lock handling. Calls SOCGameList.takeMonitor(), destroyGame(String), SOCGameList.releaseMonitor(), and broadcast(SOCDeleteGame). Doesn't call recordGameEvent(String, SOCMessage) for deletion broadcast: Any recording for the game was probably closed by destroyGame.
        Parameters:
        gaName - Game name to destroy
        descForStackTrace - Activity description in case of exception thrown from destroyGame; will debug-print a message "Exception in " + desc, followed by a stack trace. If null, will use "destroyGame".
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • hasUtilityModeProperty

        public final boolean hasUtilityModeProperty()
        True if the server was constructed with a property or command line argument which is used to run the server in Utility Mode instead of Server Mode. In Utility Mode the server reads its properties, initializes its database connection if any, and performs one task such as a password reset or table/index creation. It won't start other threads and won't fail startup if TCP port binding fails.

        Utility Mode may also set a status message, see getUtilityModeMessage().

        The current Utility Mode properties/arguments are:

        • PROP_JSETTLERS_TEST_DB flag property
        • PROP_JSETTLERS_TEST_VALIDATE__CONFIG flag property
        • SOCDBHelper.PROP_JSETTLERS_DB_BCRYPT_WORK__FACTOR=test prop value
        • SOCDBHelper.PROP_JSETTLERS_DB_SCRIPT_SETUP property
        • SOCDBHelper.PROP_JSETTLERS_DB_UPGRADE__SCHEMA flag property
        • SOCDBHelper.PROP_JSETTLERS_DB_SETTINGS=write prop value
        • --pw-reset=username argument
        Since:
        1.1.20

      • getUtilityModeMessage

        public final java.lang.String getUtilityModeMessage()
        If hasUtilityModeProperty(), get the optional status message to print before exiting.
        Returns:
        Optional status message, or null
        Since:
        1.1.20

      • localizeKnownOptions

        public static SOCGameOptionSet localizeKnownOptions(java.util.Locale loc,
                                                    boolean updateStaticKnownOpts)
        Given a client's locale, return all known game options, localizing the descriptive names if available.
        Parameters:
        loc - Client's locale for StringManager i18n lookups: smgr.get("gameopt." + SOCGameOption.key)
        updateStaticKnownOpts - If true, localize each SOCGameOption.desc in this server class's static set of known options; for use only by client's practice-game server
        Returns:
        Known Options from SOCServerGameOptionSet.getAllKnownOptions(), with descriptions localized if available
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • leaveAllChannels

        public void leaveAllChannels(Connection c)
        Connection c is leaving the server; remove from all channels it was in. In channels where c was the last connection, calls destroyChannel(String). Sends SOCDeleteChannel to announce any destroyed channels.
        Parameters:
        c - the connection

      • leaveAllGames

        public void leaveAllGames(Connection c)
        Connection c is leaving the server; remove from all games it was in. In games where c was the last human player, calls destroyGame(String).
        Parameters:
        c - the connection

      • messageToPlayer

        public void messageToPlayer(Connection c,
                            java.lang.String eventGameName,
                            int eventPN,
                            SOCMessage mes)
        Send a message to a player or other game member. Optionally call recordGameEventTo(eventGameName, eventPN, mes).
        Parameters:
        c - the player connection; does nothing if null
        eventGameName - c's game if this should be recorded, otherwise null
        eventPN - c's player number if this is a game event which should be recorded; can be PN_REPLY_TO_UNDETERMINED or PN_OBSERVER. Otherwise PN_NON_EVENT. Ignored if eventGameName is null.
        mes - the message to send; does nothing if null
        Since:
        2.4.50

      • messageToPlayerKeyed

        public final void messageToPlayerKeyed(Connection c,
                                       java.lang.String gaName,
                                       java.lang.String key,
                                       java.lang.Object... args)
        Deprecated. Use messageToPlayerKeyed(Connection, String, int, String, Object...) instead, starting at v2.4.50
        Send a localized SOCGameServerText game text message with arguments to a player. Equivalent to: messageToPlayer(conn, new SOCGameServerText(ga, c.getLocalized(key, args)));

        The localized message text must be formatted as in MessageFormat: Placeholders for args are {0} etc, single-quotes must be repeated: ''.

        Will not record as an "event".

        Parameters:
        c - the player connection; if their version is 2.0.00 or newer, they will be sent SOCGameServerText, otherwise SOCGameTextMsg. Null c is ignored and not an error.
        gaName - game name
        key - the message localization key, from StringManager.get(String), to look up and send text of
        args - Any parameters within txt's placeholders
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        messageToPlayerKeyed(Connection, String, int, String), messageToPlayerKeyedSpecial(Connection, SOCGame, int, String, Object...), messageToPlayerPendingKeyed(SOCPlayer, String, String)

      • messageToPlayerKeyedSpecial

        public final void messageToPlayerKeyedSpecial(Connection c,
                                              SOCGame ga,
                                              int eventPN,
                                              java.lang.String key,
                                              java.lang.Object... args)
        Send a localized SOCGameServerText game text message with arguments to a player, with special formatting like {0,rsrcs}. Equivalent to: messageToPlayer(conn, new SOCGameServerText(ga, c.getLocalizedSpecial(ga, key, args))); Optionally calls recordGameEventTo(String, int, SOCMessage).

        The localized message text must be formatted as in MessageFormat: Placeholders for args are {0} etc, single-quotes must be repeated: ''. For the SoC-specific parameters such as {0,rsrcs}, see the javadoc for SOCStringManager.getSpecial(SOCGame, String, Object...).

        Parameters:
        c - the player connection; if their version is 2.0.00 or newer, they will be sent SOCGameServerText, otherwise SOCGameTextMsg. Null c is ignored and not an error.
        ga - the game
        eventPN - c's player number if this is a game event which should be recorded; otherwise PN_NON_EVENT
        key - the message localization key, from StringManager.get(String), to look up and send text of
        args - Any parameters within txt's placeholders
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        messageToPlayerKeyed(Connection, String, int, String)

      • messageToPlayerPendingKeyed

        public final void messageToPlayerPendingKeyed(SOCPlayer pl,
                                              java.lang.String gaName,
                                              java.lang.String key)
        Add a pending localized SOCGameServerText game text message to SOCPlayer.pendingMessagesOut, to be sent soon to player's client with SOCGameHandler.sendGamePendingMessages(SOCGame, boolean).

        If client's version is 2.0.00 or newer they will be sent SOCGameServerText, otherwise SOCGameTextMsg.

        All pending messages are treated as recordable "events": When the queue is sent, server will call recordGameEventTo(String, int, SOCMessage).

        Note: Only a few of the server message-handling methods check the queue; see SOCGame.pendingMessagesOut.

        Parameters:
        pl - the player; null is ignored and not an error.
        gaName - game name
        key - the message localization key, from StringManager.get(String), to look up and send text of
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        messageToPlayerKeyed(Connection, String, int, String)

        Deprecated. Use messageToGame(String, boolean, String) instead, starting at v2.4.50
        Send a server text message to the given game. Equivalent to: messageToGame(ga, new SOCGameServerText(ga, txt));

        Do not pass SOCSomeMessage.toCmd() into this method; the message type number will be GAMESERVERTEXT, not the desired SOMEMESSAGE.

        Client versions older than v2.0.00 will be sent SOCGameTextMsg(ga, SERVERNAME, txt).

        Locks: Takes, releases SOCGameList.takeMonitorForGame(String).

      • messageToGameKeyedType

        public void messageToGameKeyedType(SOCGame ga,
                                   boolean isEvent,
                                   SOCKeyedMessage msg,
                                   boolean takeMon)
        Send a game a message containing data fields and also a text field to be localized. Same as messageToGame(String, boolean, SOCMessage) but calls each member connection's c.getLocalized(key) for the localized text to send. Optionally calls recordGameEvent(String, SOCMessage).

        Locks: If takeMon is true, takes and releases gameList.takeMonitorForGame(gameName). Otherwise call gameList.takeMonitorForGame(gameName) before calling this method.

        Parameters:
        ga - The game
        isEvent - if true, calls recordGameEvent(String, SOCMessage); see that method for its message version requirements
        msg - The data message to be sent after localizing text. This message object's fields are not changed here, the localization results are not kept with msg.
        takeMon - Should this method take and release game's monitor via gameList.takeMonitorForGame(gameName)? True unless caller already holds that monitor.
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        messageToGameKeyed(SOCGame, boolean, boolean, String), messageToGameKeyed(SOCGame, boolean, boolean, String, Object...)

      • messageToGameKeyed

        public void messageToGameKeyed(SOCGame ga,
                               boolean takeMon,
                               java.lang.String key)
                        throws java.util.MissingResourceException
        Deprecated. Use messageToGameKeyed(SOCGame, boolean, boolean, String) instead, starting at v2.4.50
        Send a localized SOCGameServerText game text message to a game. Same as messageToGame(String, boolean, String) but calls each member connection's c.getLocalized(key) for the localized text to send.

        Game members with null locale (such as robots) will not be sent the message. Client versions older than v2.0.00 will be sent SOCGameTextMsg(ga, SERVERNAME, txt).

        Locks: If takeMon is true, takes and releases SOCGameList.takeMonitorForGame(String). Otherwise call gameList.takeMonitorForGame(gaName) before calling this method.

        Parameters:
        ga - the game object
        takeMon - Should this method take and release game's monitor via SOCGameList.takeMonitorForGame(String) ? True unless caller already holds that monitor.
        key - the message localization key, from StringManager.get(String), to look up and send text of. If its localized text begins with ">>>", the client should consider this an urgent message, and draw the user's attention in some way. (See messageToGameUrgent(String, boolean, String))
        Throws:
        java.util.MissingResourceException - if no string can be found for key; this is a RuntimeException
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • messageToGameKeyedSpecial

        public final void messageToGameKeyedSpecial(SOCGame ga,
                                            boolean isEvent,
                                            boolean takeMon,
                                            java.lang.String key,
                                            java.lang.Object... params)
                                     throws java.util.MissingResourceException,
                                            java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Send a localized SOCGameServerText game text message (with parameters) to a game, optionally with special formatting like {0,rsrcs}. Same as messageToGame(String, boolean, String) but calls each member connection's c.getLocalizedSpecial(...) for the localized text to send. Optionally calls recordGameEvent(String, SOCMessage).

        For the SoC-specific parameters such as {0,rsrcs}, see the javadoc for SOCStringManager.getSpecial(SOCGame, String, Object...).

        Game members with null locale (such as robots) will not be sent the message. Client versions older than v2.0.00 will be sent SOCGameTextMsg(ga, SERVERNAME, txt).

        Locks: If takeMon is true, takes and releases SOCGameList.takeMonitorForGame(String). Otherwise call gameList.takeMonitorForGame(gaName) before calling this method.

        Parameters:
        ga - the game object
        isEvent - if true, calls recordGameEvent(String, SOCMessage); see that method for its message version requirements
        takeMon - Should this method take and release game's monitor via SOCGameList.takeMonitorForGame(String) ? True unless caller already holds that monitor.
        key - the message localization key, from StringManager.get(String), to look up and send text of. If its localized text begins with ">>>", the client should consider this an urgent message, and draw the user's attention in some way. (See messageToGameUrgent(String, boolean, String))
        params - Objects to use with {0}, {1}, etc in the localized string by calling MessageFormat.format(String, Object...).

        These objects can include SOCResourceSet or pairs of Integers for a resource count and type; see SOCStringManager.getSpecial(SOCGame, String, Object...).

        Throws:
        java.util.MissingResourceException - if no string can be found for key; this is a RuntimeException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the localized pattern string has a parse error (closing '}' brace without opening '{' brace, etc)
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        messageToGameKeyedSpecialExcept(SOCGame, int, boolean, Connection, String, Object...), messageToGameKeyed(SOCGame, boolean, boolean, String), messageToGameForVersionsKeyed(SOCGame, int, int, boolean, boolean, String, Object...)

      • messageToGameKeyedSpecialExcept

        public final void messageToGameKeyedSpecialExcept(SOCGame ga,
                                                  int eventExclPN,
                                                  boolean takeMon,
                                                  Connection ex,
                                                  java.lang.String key,
                                                  java.lang.Object... params)
                                           throws java.util.MissingResourceException,
                                                  java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Send a localized SOCGameServerText game text message (with parameters) to a game, optionally with special formatting like {0,rsrcs}, optionally excluding one connection. Same as messageToGame(String, boolean, String) but calls each member connection's c.getLocalizedSpecial(...) for the localized text to send. Optionally calls recordGameEvent(String, SOCMessage).

        Game members with null locale (such as robots) will not be sent the message.

        Parameters:
        ga - the game object
        eventExclPN - If this is an event that should be recorded, ex's player number; otherwise PN_NON_EVENT
        takeMon - Should this method take and release game's monitor via SOCGameList.takeMonitorForGame(String) ? True unless caller already holds that monitor.
        ex - the excluded connection, or null
        key - the message localization key, from StringManager.get(String), to look up and send text of. If its localized text begins with ">>>", the client should consider this an urgent message, and draw the user's attention in some way. (See messageToGameUrgent(String, boolean, String))
        params - Objects to use with {0}, {1}, etc in the localized string by calling MessageFormat.format(String, Object...).

        These objects can include SOCResourceSet or pairs of Integers for a resource count and type; see SOCStringManager.getSpecial(SOCGame, String, Object...).

        Throws:
        java.util.MissingResourceException - if no string can be found for key; this is a RuntimeException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the localized pattern string has a parse error (closing '}' brace without opening '{' brace, etc)
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        messageToGameKeyedSpecialExcept(SOCGame, int[], boolean, List, String, Object...), messageToGameKeyed(SOCGame, boolean, boolean, String), messageToGameForVersionsKeyedExcept(SOCGame, int, int, boolean, List, boolean, String, Object...)

      • messageToGameExcept

        public void messageToGameExcept(java.lang.String gn,
                                Connection ex,
                                int eventExclPN,
                                java.lang.String txt,
                                boolean takeMon)
        Send a server text message to all the connections in a game, excluding one. Equivalent to: messageToGameExcept(gn, new SOCGameTextMsg(gn, SERVERNAME, txt), takeMon); Optionally calls recordGameEventNotTo(String, int, SOCMessage).

        Do not pass SOCSomeMessage.toCmd() into this method; the message type number will be GAMETEXTMSG, not the desired SOMEMESSAGE.

        Parameters:
        gn - the name of the game
        ex - the excluded connection, or null
        eventExclPN - ex's player number if this is a game event which should be recorded; otherwise PN_NON_EVENT
        txt - the message text to send.

        If you need to format the message (with placeholders for i18n), call MessageFormat.format(fmt, args) on it first.

        If text begins with ">>>", the client should consider this an urgent message, and draw the user's attention in some way. (See messageToGameUrgent(String, boolean, String))

        takeMon - Should this method take and release game's monitor via SOCGameList.takeMonitorForGame(String) ? True unless caller already holds that monitor.
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        messageToGame(String, boolean, String), messageToGameExcept(String, Connection, int, SOCMessage, boolean), messageToGameExcept(String, List, int[], SOCMessage, boolean)

      • messageToGameForVersions

        public final void messageToGameForVersions(SOCGame ga,
                                           int vmin,
                                           int vmax,
                                           SOCMessage mes,
                                           boolean takeMon)
        Send a message to all the connections in a game in a certain version range. Used for backwards compatibility.

        If the message sent here should be recorded as a game event and recordGameEventsIsActive(), caller should also call recordGameEvent(String, SOCMessage) with a message appropriate for the current version.

        Parameters:
        ga - the game
        vmin - Minimum version to send to, or -1. Same format as Version.versionNumber() and Connection.getRemoteVersion().
        vmax - Maximum version to send to, or Integer.MAX_VALUE
        mes - the message
        takeMon - Should this method take and release game's monitor via SOCGameList.takeMonitorForGame(String) ? If the game's clients are all older than vmin or newer than vmax, nothing happens and the monitor isn't taken.
        Since:
        1.1.19
        See Also:
        messageToGameForVersionsKeyed(SOCGame, int, int, boolean, boolean, String, Object...)

      • messageToGameForVersionsKeyed

        public final void messageToGameForVersionsKeyed(SOCGame ga,
                                                int vmin,
                                                int vmax,
                                                boolean takeMon,

                                                java.lang.String key,

                                         throws java.util.MissingResourceException,

        Send a localized SOCGameServerText game text message (optionally with parameters) to all the connections in a game in a certain version range, except bots. Same as messageToGameForVersions(SOCGame, int, int, SOCMessage, boolean) but calls each member connection's c.getLocalized(key) for the localized text to send.

        Game members with null locale (such as robots) will not be sent the message. Client versions older than v2.0.00 will be sent SOCGameTextMsg(ga, SERVERNAME, txt).

        If the message sent here should be recorded as a game event and recordGameEventsIsActive(), caller should also call recordGameEvent(String, SOCMessage) with a message appropriate for the current version.

        Locks: If takeMon is true, takes and releases SOCGameList.takeMonitorForGame(String). Otherwise call gameList.takeMonitorForGame(gaName) before calling this method.

        Parameters:
